item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close
item.description: Top News Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close 2 hours ago Indian markets closed positively on December 12, with Nifty 50 breaching 26,000 and Sensex surpassing 85,000. The session saw a broad-based rally with 61% of traded stocks advancing. InterGlobe Aviation clarified no SEBI investigation and disclosed a CGST penalty. Infosys witnessed significant promoter share sales.

item.title: Three M Paper Boards Limited Receives Credit Rating Reaffirmation from CARE Ratings
item.description: Three M Paper Boards Limited Receives Credit Rating Reaffirmation from CARE Ratings 15 minutes ago Three M Paper Boards Limited received credit rating reaffirmation from CARE Ratings Limited on December 10, 2025. The rating agency maintained CARE BBB- for long-term bank facilities and CARE A3 for short-term facilities, covering total bank facilities worth ₹85.41 crores. The ratings were based on the company's operational and financial performance for FY25 and H1FY26.

item.title: Swati Projects Limited Reports Strong Q2FY26 Results with Consolidated Net Profit of ₹517.65 Lakh
item.description: Swati Projects Limited Reports Strong Q2FY26 Results with Consolidated Net Profit of ₹517.65 Lakh 3 hours ago Swati Projects Limited announced unaudited Q2FY26 results, showing significant consolidated growth. Consolidated total income surged to ₹2,361.20 lakh, a 5,549.20% increase from Q2FY25. Net profit rose by 1,982.73% to ₹517.65 lakh. Standalone operations remained stable with a 12.83% increase in income. The company's consolidated half-year performance was strong, with total income of ₹2,424.33 lakh and net profit of ₹452.57 lakh. The company maintains full regulatory compliance and a strong financial position.

item.title: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years
item.description: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years 9 hours ago Reliance Retail, India's largest retail chain and a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, has announced plans to potentially launch an Initial Public Offering (IPO) within the next three years. This move could provide investors an opportunity to participate in India's retail sector growth, enhance the company's access to capital, and increase operational transparency. As India's largest retail chain, Reliance Retail's potential IPO could be a significant event in the Indian market.

item.title: Reliance Retail Plans IPO Launch Within Three Years
